intro: Cystium scorpionis, commonly known as the scorpion's thorn, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Cystium scorpionis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal areas and scrublands.
